options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A statement that is only true for one prisoner.

options.label: A

options.label: C

title: How to make an attractive city

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's main argument about cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Cities are inherently chaotic and can't be made beautiful.

options.label: B
options.text: Cities are a necessary evil and should be left to chance.

options.label: C
options.text: Cities can be made beautiful if we apply scientific principles and design rules.

options.label: D
options.text: Cities are only beautiful if they are old and historic.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ideal balance between order and chaos in a city?

options.label: C
options.text: A balance between order and variety.

options.label: D
options.text: A balance between order and randomness.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument about the importance of visible life in cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as efficient as possible, even if it means hiding life away.

options.label: B
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as beautiful as possible, even if it means hiding life away.

options.label: C
options.text: Cities should be designed to be full of life and activity, with visible work and people.

options.label: D
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as quiet as possible, with minimal noise and activity.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ideal height for a city block, according to the author?

options.label: D
options.text: There is no ideal height for a city block.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument about the importance of local character in cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as generic as possible, with no local character.

options.label: B
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as unique as possible, with no local character.

options.label: C
options.text: Cities should be designed to reflect the local culture, history, and materials.

options.label: D
options.text: Cities should be designed to be as functional as possible, with no consideration for local character.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main obstacle to building beautiful cities, according to the author?

options.label: B
options.text: Lack of intellectual understanding of beauty.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument about the importance of democracy in designing cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Democracy is not important in designing cities, as long as the developers are happy.

options.label: B
options.text: Democracy is essential in designing cities, as it ensures that the public good is prioritized.

options.label: C
options.text: Democracy is not necessary in designing cities, as the market will sort it out.

options.label: D
options.text: Democracy is a hindrance in designing cities, as it leads to conflict and inefficiency.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument about the importance of beauty in cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Beauty is subjective and there is no such thing as objective beauty.

options.label: B
options.text: Beauty is objective and there are certain principles that can be applied to create beautiful cities.

options.label: C
options.text: Beauty is not important in cities, as long as they are functional.

options.label: D
options.text: Beauty is only important in historic cities, not in modern cities.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument about the role of governments in creating beautiful cities?

options.label: A
options.text: Governments should not get involved in designing cities, as it's a private matter.

options.label: B
options.text: Governments should impose strict regulations to ensure that cities are designed with beauty in mind.

options.label: C
options.text: Governments should leave the design of cities to the market, as it will sort it out.

options.label: D
options.text: Governments should not prioritize beauty in cities, as it's not a priority.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's call to action at the end of the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: To abandon the idea of creating beautiful cities.

options.label: B
options.text: To continue to prioritize commercial interests over public good.

options.label: C
options.text: To fight for the implementation of the six rules for creating beautiful cities.

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore the issue of beauty in cities altogether.

multiple-choice.question: What is the average frequency of supernovae per year in a galaxy the size and age of the Milky Way?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: What’s the big deal with gluten? - William D. Chey

multiple-choice.question: What is gluten?

options.label: B
options.text: An insoluble protein composite made up of two proteins named gliadin and glutenin

options.label: C
options.text: A type of sugar found in wheat and other foods

options.label: D
options.text: A type of fiber found in wheat and other grains

multiple-choice.question: What is celiac disease?

options.label: A
options.text: A condition in which eating foods with gluten leads to inflammation and damage of the lining of the small intestine

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A condition in which a person experiences painful gut symptoms and suffers from fatigue, brain fog, and joint pain

options.label: D
options.text: A condition in which a person has a gluten-free diet

options.text: A condition in which a person has a wheat allergy

options.label: B
options.text: A condition in which a person has celiac disease

options.label: C
options.text: A condition in which a person experiences symptoms when they eat foods with gluten, but does not have celiac disease or a wheat allergy

options.label: D
options.text: A condition in which a person has a gluten-free diet

options.label: B
options.text: A phenomenon in which a person's symptoms worsen when they believe they are taking a treatment

options.label: C

options.label: D
